purpose: Teach agents how to facilitate WAFR workshops with clients - the soft skills, engagement techniques, and workshop delivery best practices
relevance: CRITICAL - Your agents need to know HOW to conduct workshops, not just WHAT to ask. This is about facilitation, engagement, and client experience.

workshop_overview.workshop_purpose: Learn how to facilitate Well-Architected reviews using the AWS WA Tool
workshop_overview.duration: 2-3 hours (for learning), actual client workshops: 4-8 hours

option_1_self_paced.description: Individuals go through workshop at their own pace

option_2_instructor_led.your_platform_equivalent: Guided workshop mode (agent facilitates, client participates)

format: Post-work: Apply learnings to real workload
option_3_hybrid.your_platform_equivalent: Your recommended approach: AI self-service + optional live review

1_week_before: Test all exercises in AWS console
Send calendar invites with Zoom links
3_days_before: Prepare backup slides (in case demos fail)
day_of: Test screen sharing one more time
Have AWS console open and ready

what_you_automate: ‚úÖ No AWS account setup needed (your platform handles it)
‚úÖ No IAM permissions needed (your platform's service account)
‚úÖ No pre-reading (AI explains as you go)

your_platform_equivalent.example: Hi! I'm here to guide you through your Well-Architected Review. This will take about 20 minutes. Think of this as a helpful conversation, not an audit. Ready to get started?

interactive_elements: Poll: Who has done a WAFR before?
Q&A: What challenges do you face?
Discussion: Which pillar is most important to you?

your_platform_equivalent.example: The Well-Architected Framework has 6 pillars - think of them like the foundation of a building. If security is weak, the whole system is at risk. Let me explain each one briefly...

hands_on_exercise.task: Define your workload in WA Tool
facilitator_tips: Check that everyone is keeping up

your_platform_equivalent.automation: AI asks 10 questions, auto-creates workload via WA Tool API

facilitator_guidance: Choose one pillar to do together (e.g., Security)
Discuss as group: How would you answer?
Show how to mark as 'Not applicable'
Emphasize: Document WHY, not just WHAT
facilitator_tips: This is the most important section - take your time
Share real-world examples for each question
Remind them: This is current state, not future state

facilitator_guidance: Show how to generate PDF report

facilitator_tips: Don't overwhelm with too many recommendations
Help them prioritize (quick wins vs. long-term)
Emphasize: This is a journey, not a destination
Encourage them to start using WAFR

techniques: Start with positive intent: 'This is to help, not judge'
Celebrate good practices: 'Great job on encryption!'
Frame issues as opportunities: 'Chance to improve'

your_agent_behavior.report_agent: Constructive, focuses on opportunities not failures

techniques: Use a visible timer for exercises
Have a 'parking lot' for tangential discussions
Build in buffer time (things always take longer)
time_management_tips: End on time (or early, never late)
If running behind, skip optional content, not core exercises

your_platform_advantage.no_coordination: No need to schedule multiple stakeholders

3_encourage_participation.principle: Get everyone involved, not just the vocal ones
techniques: Ask open-ended questions: 'What challenges have you faced?'
Use polls (Zoom, Mentimeter): 'Which pillar interests you most?'
Call on quiet participants: 'Sarah, what's your experience with...?'
question_handling: Repeat question for everyone: 'Great question about...'
Validate all questions: 'That's an important point'
Defer deep dives: 'Let's take that offline'
Turn questions back to group: 'Has anyone else faced this?'

your_platform_equivalent.1_on_1_conversation: AI gives full attention to each client

response: Acknowledge their concern: 'I understand this feels overwhelming'
Reframe: 'This shows areas to improve, which is the goal'
Normalize: 'No workload is perfect, even AWS's own systems have room to improve'
Focus on wins: 'You have strong encryption - that's great!'
Emphasize: 'This is confidential, not a compliance audit'

your_agent_behavior.example: I see you have some areas flagged as high-risk. This is normal! Every workload has trade-offs. Let's focus on the quick wins first...

scenario_2_client_argues.situation: Client disagrees with AWS best practice
response: Listen fully: 'Tell me more about your approach'
Acknowledge trade-offs: 'You're right, that's a valid reason'
Explain AWS reasoning: 'The concern is...'
Document exception: 'Let's note your specific context'
Offer alternatives: 'Have you considered...?'
Respect decision: 'Ultimately it's your call'

your_agent_behavior.not_rigid: AI explains reasoning, doesn't force compliance
your_agent_behavior.suppression_support: Use KB #8 suppression for accepted risks

scenario_3_client_overwhelmed.situation: Too many recommendations, client doesn't know where to start
response: Validate feelings: 'Yes, it's a lot!'
Prioritize: 'Let's focus on top 3 high-risk items'
Quick wins: 'Some are easy fixes, like enabling CloudTrail'
Roadmap: '90-day plan, not all at once'
Celebrate progress: 'You've taken the first step by doing this review!'
Offer support: 'We can help you implement these'

your_agent_behavior.auto_prioritization: Report Agent sorts by impact and effort

scenario_4_technical_question_you_dont_k.situation: Client asks technical question you can't answer
response: Be honest: 'Great question - I don't know off the top of my head'
Document it: 'Let me write that down'
Follow up: 'I'll research and email you by tomorrow'
Crowdsource: 'Has anyone else encountered this?'
Redirect: 'Let's continue and I'll circle back'

your_agent_behavior.rag_powered: AI has 8 knowledge bases to reference
your_agent_behavior.citations: AI provides links to official AWS docs
your_agent_behavior.escalation: For complex questions, offer human SA consultation

5_use_visual_aids.principle: People remember visuals better than words
screen_sharing_tips: Share specific window, not entire screen

your_agent_implementation.discovery_agent: I worked with an e-commerce company that didn't have multi-region backups. During Black Friday, their database went down and they lost $500K in sales. Multi-region is critical for revenue-critical workloads.
your_agent_implementation.assessment_agent: Think of encryption like locking your house. You might live in a safe neighborhood, but you still lock your doors, right?
your_agent_implementation.report_agent: One of our clients implemented these 3 recommendations and saved $15K per month. Let's see which ones apply to you.

social_proof.why: People trust what others have done
examples: 85% of AWS customers use multi-AZ for production
AWS's own services follow these practices
Your competitors are likely doing this

your_agent_implementation.benchmarking: Customer History MCP (MCP Tool #5) shows how client compares to peers
your_agent_implementation.industry_stats: Agent cites AWS statistics and case studies
your_agent_implementation.peer_comparison: Companies your size typically score 75% in Security pillar

your_platform_implementation.improvement_tracking: Your Security score improved from 65% to 85% since last quarter!

actions: Share completed WA Tool workload link
Offer to review their improvement plan
Share relevant case studies or blogs

your_platform_automation.immediate: Auto-send email with report and next steps

during_workshop: Time on task (are they keeping pace?)
post_workshop: Re-assessment rate (% who do quarterly reviews)

kb_9_usage: Opening message: Use 'Set the Tone' techniques
Pace management: 'You're 50% complete, about 10 minutes left'
Handle pauses: 'Take your time, I'm here when you're ready'
Social proof: 'Most companies in your industry...'
Active listening: 'So what I'm hearing is...'

responsibilities: Provide context for each best practice

kb_9_usage: No blame: 'This is common, let's clarify'
Offer help: 'Would you like me to check your AWS config?'
Quick wins: 'Some are easy, like enabling CloudTrail'

self_service_mode.description: Client completes assessment independently with AI guidance

workflow: AI handles discovery & data collection (10 mins)
Human SA joins for discussion (45 mins)
AI generates report while SA discusses next steps (5 mins)
agent_behavior: Prepare summary for SA before they join
Update workload based on SA insights

workflow: Pre-work: Each stakeholder answers relevant questions (async)
Live session: SA facilitates discussion of findings
AI aggregates responses & generates consensus view
agent_behavior: Support SA during live session (chat assistant)

welcome_sequence: 3. Sample workload: Try it with dummy data

welcome_back: Welcome back! Last assessment was 3 months ago

key_takeaways_for_your_agents.1_tone_matters: Warm, supportive, non-judgmental. Say 'let's explore' not 'you failed'
key_takeaways_for_your_agents.2_storytelling_works: Use examples, analogies, case studies. Make it relatable.
key_takeaways_for_your_agents.3_visual_aids_help: Progress bars, pillar scores, diagrams. People are visual.
key_takeaways_for_your_agents.4_manage_overwhelm: Prioritize top 3, quick wins, 90-day plan. Not all at once.
key_takeaways_for_your_agents.5_celebrate_wins: Point out what they're doing well. Build confidence.
key_takeaways_for_your_agents.6_pace_matters: Don't rush. Let client work at their pace. Pause/resume anytime.
key_takeaways_for_your_agents.7_follow_up_essential: Workshop doesn't end at report. Check in, support, track progress.
key_takeaways_for_your_agents.8_make_it_safe: This is to help, not judge. Private, confidential, collaborative.
